snippet: Mark Deli Siljander, a former Republican congressman accused of accepting stolen money on behalf of a Missouri charity believed to have terrorism ties, was sentenced to a year in federal prison.
abstract: Mark Deli Siljander, a former Republican congressman accused of accepting stolen money on behalf of Islamic American Relief Agency, a Missouri charity believed to have terrorism ties, is sentenced to a year in federal prison.
lead_paragraph: Mark Deli Siljander, a former Republican congressman accused of accepting stolen money on behalf of a Missouri charity believed to have terrorism ties, was sentenced to a year in federal prison.

headline.seo: Michigan: Ex-Congressman Siljander Gets One-Year Sentence
